starvationevasion.sim

Class PackedTileData

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.PackedTileData

  • public class PackedTileData
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for packed tile data. Tile coordinates are packed into a 32 bit integer. the first 16 bits hold the latitude, the last 16 bits hold the longitude. the lat and lon are rounded to two decimal places and multiplied by 100 before being packed Crop ratings for all 12 foods are packed into 3 bytes per tile. 2 bits per food * 12 foods = 24 bits = 3 bytes; How to unpack: index from 0 to # of land tiles: PackedTileData.unpackLatitude(PACKED_TILE_COORDINATES, index); PackedTileData.unpackLongitude(PACKED_TILE_COORDINATES, index); PackedTileData.unpackCropRatings(PACKED_CROP_RATINGS, index);

      • unpackCropRatings

        public static EnumCropZone[] unpackCropRatings(byte[] packedData,
                                               int index)
        unpacks crop ratings for a single land tile. example of use: cropRatings[EnumFood.CROP_FOODS[EnumFood.CITRUS.ordinal()]] returns rating for citrus
        Parameters:
        index - index of tile to unpack
        Returns:
        an array of ratings for each crop
